snippet: The Defense Department is consolidating some of the small counseling programs created to stem a rise in suicides during the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.
abstract: Vets4Warriors, hotline in Piscataway, NJ, that offers peer counciling for military troops and former service members, seeks financial backing to stay open after Pentagon ends funding; has received $2.5 million from State of New Jersey that will allow it to operate for year.
lead_paragraph: The Defense Department is consolidating some of the small counseling programs created to stem a rise in suicides during the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.

headline.main: Veterans Hotline Tries to Survive Without Pentagon Funds
headline.print_headline: Peer Hotline for Armed Forces Aims to Endure Without Pentagon
